translated: Compassion that focuses on sentient beings who are not liberated due to not having the conditions refers to sentient beings who have not heard the Dharma because they do not have a spiritual friend.

original: de yang rgyud las /
analyzed: de yang rgyud las /
translated: The Tantra of the Wheel of Time states:

original: dge bshes ma bsten chos ma mnyan bya ba dang / ma grol ba'i sems can la snying rjes grol bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dge bshes ma bsten chos ma mnyan bya ba dang / ma grol ba'i sems can la snying rjes grol bar byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should liberate those sentient beings who are not liberated through compassion by relying on a spiritual friend and listening to the Dharma.

original: de la dga' ba ni de la sems can dag zang zing gi 'byor ba dang / chos kyi 'byor ba dang / bde ba'i 'byor ba dang ldan pas dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de la dga' ba ni de la sems can dag zang zing gi 'byor ba dang / chos kyi 'byor ba dang / bde ba'i 'byor ba dang ldan pas dga' ba'o //
translated: Joy is the joy of sentient beings who possess the wealth of material things, the wealth of Dharma, and the wealth of happiness.

original: bdag gi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa la dmigs pa'i dga' ba ni bdag nyid dge ba'i tshogs che ba la dmigs nas dga' ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag gi tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa la dmigs pa'i dga' ba ni bdag nyid dge ba'i tshogs che ba la dmigs nas dga' ba'i don to //
translated: Joy that focuses on the completion of one‚Äôs own accumulations refers to joy that focuses on one‚Äôs own great accumulation of virtue.

original: dam pa'i chos kyi ro la dmigs pa'i dga' ba ni bdag dang gzhan chos thos pa'i ro dang / bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i ro rnyed pa'i sgo nas dga' ba'i don to //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi ro la dmigs pa'i dga' ba ni bdag dang gzhan chos thos pa'i ro dang / bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i ro rnyed pa'i sgo nas dga' ba'i don to //
translated: The joy of the taste of the holy Dharma has the meaning of joy through obtaining the taste of hearing the Dharma for oneself and for others, and the taste of reflection and meditation.

original: de la btang snyoms ni sems can gyi don la spyod pa dag ni skal ba yod pa dang skal ba med pa'i btang snyoms ni /üîΩskal ba dang ldan pa'i don ni bya /
analyzed: de la btang snyoms ni sems can gyi don la spyod pa dag ni skal ba yod pa dang skal ba med pa'i btang snyoms ni / skal ba dang ldan pa'i don ni bya /
translated: Equanimity is the equanimity of those who practice for the sake of sentient beings, who are indifferent to whether or not they have the fortune.

original: skal ba dang mi ldan pa'i don ni mi bya zhes de ltar 'byed pa med par gnyis ka'i don snyoms par bya zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩ'jig rten gyi chos brgyad po rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa la sogs pa'i sgras bsdus pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: skal ba dang mi ldan pa'i don ni mi bya zhes de ltar 'byed pa med par gnyis ka'i don snyoms par bya zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad po rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa la sogs pa'i sgras bsdus pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The meaning of having fortune is to act; the meaning of not having fortune is not to act. The meaning of equanimity is to act for the sake of both without making such distinctions.üîΩThe eight worldly dharmas are the four pairs of gain and loss, etc.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bstod pa dang / smad pa dang / grags pa dang / ma grags pa la dga' ba dang mi dga' ba med par btang snyoms su gnas pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bstod pa dang / smad pa dang / grags pa dang / ma grags pa la dga' ba dang mi dga' ba med par btang snyoms su gnas pa ste /
translated: They are the joy and sorrow, praise and criticism, fame and disgrace, and pleasure and pain that arise from the eight worldly dharmas.

original: de la 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad ni rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa la sogs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad ni rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa la sogs pa la bya ste /
translated: The eight worldly concerns are gain and loss, fame and disgrace, praise and blame, and pleasure and pain.

original: chos brgyad po de dag 'jig rten na grags shing yod pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad do //
analyzed: chos brgyad po de dag 'jig rten na grags shing yod pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad do //
translated: They are called the eight worldly concerns because they are well known and exist in the world.

original: chos brgyad po de dag la ji ltar btang snyoms su gnas she na /
analyzed: chos brgyad po de dag la ji ltar btang snyoms su gnas she na /
translated: How do we remain indifferent to these eight concerns?

original: 'di @21b ltar bdag gis longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa rnyed pa na de la dga' ba ste chags pa yang med la /
analyzed: 'di @21b ltar bdag gis longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa rnyed pa na de la dga' ba ste chags pa yang med la /
translated: When we acquire perfect wealth, we are neither pleased nor attached to it.

original: longs spyod 'gribs sam ma rnyed na yang de yi chad pa med cing mi dga' ba med pa ni rnyed ma rnyed la dga' mi dga' med pa'i btang snyoms zhes bya'o //
analyzed: longs spyod 'gribs sam ma rnyed na yang de yi chad pa med cing mi dga' ba med pa ni rnyed ma rnyed la dga' mi dga' med pa'i btang snyoms zhes bya'o //
translated: When our wealth diminishes or we do not acquire it, we are not disappointed or displeased. This is called the equanimity of not being pleased or displeased by gain or loss.

original: bdag gi mdza' bo byams pa zhig gis bdag gi lus la spos dang tsandan la sogs pa'i byug pas nyug cing bsnyen bkur dang bsti stang byed na bkur sti'i bde ba la dga' zhing chags pa yang med la /
analyzed: bdag gi mdza' bo byams pa zhig gis bdag gi lus la spos dang tsandan la sogs pa'i byug pas nyug cing bsnyen bkur dang bsti stang byed na bkur sti'i bde ba la dga' zhing chags pa yang med la /
translated: When a friend who loves us anoints our body with perfumes, sandalwood, and so on, and serves and respects us, we are neither pleased nor attached to the happiness of being honored.

original: dgra bo zhig gis bdag gi lus la brdeg brdung la sogs pa byed na yang de la'ang mi khro zhing brdeg brdung gi sdug bsngal dang du blang ba dang / sdug go mi snyam ste /
analyzed: dgra bo zhig gis bdag gi lus la brdeg brdung la sogs pa byed na yang de la'ang mi khro zhing brdeg brdung gi sdug bsngal dang du blang ba dang / sdug go mi snyam ste /
translated: I would not think of it as suffering.

original: bde sdug la dga' mi dga' med pa'i btang snyoms zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bde sdug la dga' mi dga' med pa'i btang snyoms zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called equanimity, which is indifferent to pleasure and pain.

original: bdag gi mdza' bo zhig gis bdag gi rigs las glengs te snyan pa'i tshig gis bstod na de la dga' zhing gzengs mtho bar 'gyur ba yang med la /
analyzed: bdag gi mdza' bo zhig gis bdag gi rigs las glengs te snyan pa'i tshig gis bstod na de la dga' zhing gzengs mtho bar 'gyur ba yang med la /
translated: Even if a friend were to praise me with sweet words, talking about my family lineage, I would not be pleased and would not hold my head high.

original: dgra bo zhig gis bdag gi skyon brus shing bsgrags na yang de la yang mi dga' zhing dpa' zhum pa med pa ni bstod pa dang smad pa la dga' ba dang / mi dga' ba med pa'i btang snyoms zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dgra bo zhig gis bdag gi skyon brus shing bsgrags na yang de la yang mi dga' zhing dpa' zhum pa med pa ni bstod pa dang smad pa la dga' ba dang / mi dga' ba med pa'i btang snyoms zhes bya'o //
translated: Even if an enemy were to speak of my faults and proclaim them, I would not be displeased and would not be discouraged. This is called equanimity, which is indifferent to praise and blame.

original: bdag gi yon tan yod pa skye bo mang pos thos shing shes par gyur pa na 'di snyam du bdag ni yon tan can du skye bo mang pos shes pas bdag gi yon tan grags te ma subs so zhes yon tan grags pa la dga' ba yang medüîΩla / bdag gi yon tan skye bo mang pos ma thos shing ma shes na yang bdag gi yon tan ma grags te /
analyzed: bdag gi yon tan yod pa skye bo mang pos thos shing shes par gyur pa na 'di snyam du bdag ni yon tan can du skye bo mang pos shes pas bdag gi yon tan grags te ma subs so zhes yon tan grags pa la dga' ba yang med la / bdag gi yon tan skye bo mang pos ma thos shing ma shes na yang bdag gi yon tan ma grags te /
translated: When many people hear and know of one's good qualities, one does not think, I am known by many to be virtuous, so my good qualities are famous and not hidden.üîΩAnd when many people do not hear and know of one's good qualities, one does not think, My good qualities are not famous.

original: nub bo zhes mi dga' ba med pa ni yon tan grags pa dang ma grags pa la dga' ba dang mi dga' ba med pa'i btang snyoms zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nub bo zhes mi dga' ba med pa ni yon tan grags pa dang ma grags pa la dga' ba dang mi dga' ba med pa'i btang snyoms zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They are not elated by the fame of their good qualities or depressed by the lack of fame. This is the meaning of equanimity that is neither elated nor depressed by the fame or lack of fame of one's good qualities.

original: tshogs zhes bya ba ni gong gi tshig ste /
analyzed: tshogs zhes bya ba ni gong gi tshig ste /
translated: The term accumulation refers to the above verse.

original: tshogs yongs su bskang ba la dus dang dus ma yin pa la dmigs pa'i btang snyoms ni bdag nyid dge ba'i tshogs bskang zhing spyad pa la dus 'dir ni bya /
analyzed: tshogs yongs su bskang ba la dus dang dus ma yin pa la dmigs pa'i btang snyoms ni bdag nyid dge ba'i tshogs bskang zhing spyad pa la dus 'dir ni bya /
translated: Equanimity with regard to the timely and untimely fulfillment of accumulations refers to the timely and untimely fulfillment of one's own virtuous accumulations and practice.

original: dus 'dir ni mi bya zhes 'byed pa med par dus kun tu spyod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dus 'dir ni mi bya zhes 'byed pa med par dus kun tu spyod par byed pa'o //
translated: One does not practice them only at certain times, saying, I will not do it at this time. One practices them at all times.

original: tshad med bzhi po dag ni tshangs pa'i gnas //
analyzed: tshad med bzhi po dag ni tshangs pa'i gnas //
translated: The four immeasurables are the Brahma abodes.üîΩI have composed this

original: bsgom pa kun gyi don du bdag gis 'di //
analyzed: bsgom pa kun gyi don du bdag gis 'di //
translated: for the sake of all meditation.

original: sems can don du byas shing bsdebs pa des //
analyzed: sems can don du byas shing bsdebs pa des //
translated: By this, which I have composed for the sake of sentient beings,üîΩmay all beings be free from obscurations and quickly attain buddhahood.

original: 'gro kun sgrib bral myur du sangs rgyas shog / tshad med pa bzhi'i rgya cher 'grel pa slob dpon buddha guptas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'gro kun sgrib bral myur du sangs rgyas shog / tshad med pa bzhi'i rgya cher 'grel pa slob dpon buddha guptas mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the four immeasurables composed by Master Buddhagupta is complete.
